meanings.definition: A wild, lively, or extravagant party or celebration.
meanings.sent1: Last night's wingding was so much fun!
meanings.sent2: The neighborhood threw a wingding for the new year.
meanings.sent3: The wingding had everyone dancing until dawn.
meanings.sent4: Her birthday party was a wingding to remember.
meanings.sent5: The wingding was filled with laughter and joy.

meanings.definition: A decorative or ornamental flourish or design.
meanings.sent1: The invitation had a fancy wingding on the corner.
meanings.sent2: The cake was adorned with a beautiful wingding made of icing.
meanings.sent3: She added a little wingding to the gift wrap for extra flair.
meanings.sent4: The wingding on the necklace sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The artist's signature was a unique wingding at the bottom of the painting.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is remarkable or outstanding.
meanings.sent1: The young musician was a real wingding on stage.
meanings.sent2: The new car model turned out to be a real wingding in the market.
meanings.sent3: Her recipe for chocolate cake was a real wingding among her friends.
meanings.sent4: The old watch was a wingding, still ticking after all these years.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's dedication to her students was a true wingding in the school community.
